autoConfig.title: Automatic Open WebUI Configuration
autoConfig.description: Automatically configure Open WebUI with MCParr tools in one click.
autoConfig.notAvailableDetail: To use automatic configuration, configure the Open WebUI service with an admin API key in the Services tab.
autoConfig.errorNoServiceDetail: Please select at least one service to configure

endpointMode.label: Endpoint mode
endpointMode.groupHelp: One tool server per category (media, system, etc.) - Balance between performance and flexibility
endpointMode.serviceGroupHelp: One tool server per custom service group - Use your own groupings defined in Services ‚Üí Groups
endpointMode.serviceHelp: One tool server per service (Plex, Sonarr, etc.) - Maximum flexibility, more connections
endpointMode.allHelp: One tool server with all tools - Simple but may overload the model

autoConfig.noServiceGroupsHint: Create service groups in the Services ‚Üí Groups tab
autoConfig.errorNoServiceGroupDetail: Please select at least one custom service group to configure
autoConfig.useFunctionFiltersHelp: Restricts visible tools for each group
autoConfig.errorNoUrlDetail: Please enter the MCParr external URL
autoConfig.errorNoCategoryDetail: Please select at least one group to configure
autoConfig.requirement: Prerequisite: MCParr external URL accessible from Open WebUI

openWebUISetup.title: Open WebUI Setup - Function Filters
openWebUISetup.description: To prevent the model from being overwhelmed by too many tools, create multiple connections with filters. Here are the recommended groups:
openWebUISetup.step1: Admin Panel ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Tools ‚Üí External tools
openWebUISetup.step2: Create one connection per category with MCParr URL
openWebUISetup.step3: In 'Function Name Filter List', paste the tools below
openWebUISetup.step4: Enable all connections in model settings

media.name: üì∫ Media (Plex/Tautulli)
media.description: Libraries, search, active sessions, watch statistics

troubleshooting.title: Tools not being called?
troubleshooting.description: If the model says "I will call the tool..." but invents data, native function calling is not enabled.
troubleshooting.solution1: Use a compatible model (GPT-4, Claude, Qwen2.5, Llama 3.3)
troubleshooting.solution2: Open WebUI: Admin ‚Üí Models ‚Üí Native Tool Calling

systemPrompt.title: System Prompt
systemPrompt.location: Open WebUI ‚Üí Admin Panel ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Models ‚Üí System Prompt
systemPrompt.locationMobile: Open WebUI ‚Üí Admin ‚Üí Models ‚Üí System Prompt

simple.intro: You are a homelab assistant with access to tools.
simple.rules:
RULES:
1. CALL THE APPROPRIATE TOOL based on content type
2. PRESENT results clearly
3. NEVER make up data
simple.mappingIntro: CHOOSE TOOL BASED ON CONTENT TYPE:

systemPrompt.noTools: IMPORTANT: No tools are configured at the moment. Please configure services in the admin interface.
systemPrompt.noExamples: No examples available for configured services.
systemPrompt.rule1: **ALWAYS USE TOOLS** - When the user asks for information about the homelab (movies, series, who's watching, downloads, etc.), you MUST use the corresponding tool.
systemPrompt.rule2: **NEVER MAKE UP DATA** - If you don't have tool results, don't generate false information. Instead say "I couldn't retrieve this information".
systemPrompt.rule3: **WAIT FOR RESULT** - After calling a tool, wait for its response before formulating your answer to the user.
systemPrompt.rule4: **IN CASE OF ERROR** - If a tool fails, explain the technical error instead of making up data.
systemPrompt.format1: Convert timestamps to readable dates (format: "Nov 27 2025, 7:23 PM")
systemPrompt.format3: To check if a movie/series IS AVAILABLE ‚Üí plex_search_media with the title
systemPrompt.format5: For active sessions (who's watching what) ‚Üí tautulli_get_activity
systemPrompt.format6: For rankings (top users, movies, series) ‚Üí tautulli_get_top_* with days (default: 30)
systemPrompt.format7: For specific user stats ‚Üí tautulli_get_user_stats with username
systemPrompt.indexerTestsDesc: Each service has its OWN indexers. Use the tool from the concerned service:
systemPrompt.format10: To test all service indexers ‚Üí use {service}_test_all_indexers
systemPrompt.format11: To test specific indexer ‚Üí {service}_test_indexer with indexer_id
systemPrompt.language: Language: Respond in English unless the user uses another language.
systemPrompt.toolSelectionIntro: Choose the right tool based on the TYPE OF CONTENT requested. Don't confuse services!

audiobook.content: Audiobook, audio book, podcast, LISTEN to a book

torrentSearch.content: Search for a torrent by name

plexStats.content: Who's watching what, Plex stats, history

plex.a1: Use the plex_search_media tool with query="Avatar"

tautulli.q2: Who are the most active users this month?
tautulli.a2: Use the tautulli_get_top_users tool with days=30
tautulli.q3: What are the most watched movies this week?
tautulli.a3: Use the tautulli_get_top_movies tool with days=7
tautulli.q4: What are the most popular series?
tautulli.q5: Give me a summary of viewing statistics
tautulli.a6: Use the tautulli_get_user_stats tool with username="John"
tautulli.q7: What devices are people watching Plex on?

overseerr.a1: Use the overseerr_request_media tool with title="Gladiator 2" and media_type="movie"

radarr.q2: What indexers are configured in Radarr?

prowlarr.a3: Use the prowlarr_search tool with query="Avatar"

komga.q1: What comic libraries do I have?

romm.q2: What are the latest games added?
romm.a3: Use the romm_search_roms tool with query="Mario"
romm.a4: Use the romm_get_recently_added tool with days=7

zammad.q1: Create a support ticket for a login issue
zammad.a1: Use the zammad_create_ticket tool with title="Login issue" and body="Issue description"
zammad.a4: Use the zammad_add_comment tool with ticket_id=125 and comment="Comment content"
zammad.a5: Use the zammad_update_ticket_status tool with ticket_id=125 and status="closed"

audiobookshelf.q2: What audiobooks have I recently added?
audiobookshelf.a3: Use the audiobookshelf_search tool with query="Harry Potter"

wikijs.q1: Search the wiki for how to configure Plex
wikijs.a1: Use the wikijs_search_pages tool with query="configure Plex"
wikijs.a2: Use the wikijs_get_page tool with page_id=42

authentik.q3: What applications are configured in Authentik?

system.q2: What are the current CPU/memory metrics?
system.a4: Use the system_test_service tool with service_name="Plex"
system.a6: Use the system_get_logs tool with level="error"
system.a7: Use the system_get_alerts tool with active_only=true

create.title: Create Tool Chain
create.name: Name
create.priorityHelp: Higher priority chains are evaluated first
create.stepsInfo: After creating the chain, you can add steps with trigger conditions and target tools.

detail.name: Name
detail.priorityHelp: Higher priority chains are evaluated first
detail.stepsHelp: Each step defines a trigger (source tool + condition) and target tools to execute
detail.selectChain: Select a chain to view details
